website_summaries.verdict: The Surface Pro's gutsy design successfully reinvents the Windows 8 laptop by cramming an ultrabook experience into the body of a 10-inch tablet. Those wanting to go all-in on the tablet experience won't regret buying the Surface Pro, but we're holding out for a future, more polished generation of the device.
pros: The Microsoft Surface Pro fits a full ultrabook experience in a compact 10-inch tablet
Thanks to the ingenious Type and Touch covers, it offers a comfortable interface and typing experience
The clean, crisp design and sharp 1080p screen rise above the competition
cons: The battery life is disappointing, and more ports would be nice
The 64GB model barely has any free storage
It costs as much as a regular laptop, especially because the cool keyboard cover isn't included by default

customer_reviews.title: I now see what all the hype about the Surface devices is.
customer_reviews.text: Being as this is the oldest version of this device, I wasn't expecting a lot, but I got really attached to it rather quickly. The battery life is patently terrible, but aside from that, I'm really happy with it. The really major problem with this is that now I want a Surface 6 and have to save up for it.
customer_reviews.author: T. Horst

customer_reviews.title: IT'S NOT A PRO!!!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if anyone got the same Surface that I got. But this Surface is NOT the Surface Pro 1. It's the regular RT version. Which means no desktop apps, and no pen. I need both of these for using Photoshop, and programming like Eclipse and Visual Studio. Very disappointed. And I've decided to find a Surface Pro 2 and return this once I have it. On the other hand, the only reason why I give this two stars, is because the tablet was like new when I got it. Impressive for something that's used.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. El

customer_reviews.title: Great for it's time
customer_reviews.text: Great little portable pc. Pen sensitivity isn't amazing and it's performance is a bit dated now, but great for it's time and those who are not looking to use demanding software.
customer_reviews.author: ozaffer

customer_reviews.title: Eveything good, exept for the storage space.
customer_reviews.text: Great display, great system, easy to use, can install any program I want. I prefer this than a tablet... The only problem is the storage space... It say "64gb" memory but its has like 27gb only, that is less than the 50%, and I feel scammed... I read everything I could but never saw that... I wish I could desinstall something but I there nothing I can. Ill have to buy some external hard drive, i just hope I dont have any problem with program installation.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Rivera

customer_reviews.title: I cannot believe Microsoft made this!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best computers ever. A little on the heavy side, but once I upgraded to Win10, I rarely use my desktop. This is a flat out amazing computer. Can only image how much better Surface 4 is. No way did Microsoft actually build something this awesome.
customer_reviews.author: El Jefe

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought from Microsoft directly.
customer_reviews.text: I changed the language when I received this tablet but really had to search for English and the correct keyboard because the default was middle eastern. I returned because it would disconnect from my network whenever there was an update. i pre-ordered the new surface from Microsoft for the same price.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Sitzes

customer_reviews.title: This device truly replaced my lap top. I purchased ...
customer_reviews.text: This device truly replaced my lap top. I purchased this device before a several week trip to Ireland. While there I didn't need a notebook, textbook, or computer because this did it all. I suggest getting a warranty with this in case dropped or damaged.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's fine
customer_reviews.text: It's great for being on the go but I got the 64GB and I thought that would be enough to download some videos but now I only have like 1 GB left. I don't know how that's possible since each video is under 1 GB and there are about 18 of them. Makes no sense to me. The keyboard is great but the @ sign and " are switched on the board so that is annoying but other than that it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: clarkie

customer_reviews.title: Very awesome
customer_reviews.text: So if you are looking for a computer & a tablet, search no more. The Windows Surface Pro is different than it's RT cousin; the Surface Pro enables the usage of legacy programs because it is using a Intel i5 Core Processor. What does this mean? Unlike the RT's ARM processor, the Surface Pro can play video programs such as Hearthstone, StarCraft 2, and so on as well as programs available from the windows store. It's just a very powerful tablet, there's nothing bad I can say about it.
customer_reviews.author: Devan Reisig

customer_reviews.title: This is not pro 3 but RT
customer_reviews.text: Its ok windows tablet. Be aware this is Not pro 3 but RT.
customer_reviews.author: nicky

customer_reviews.title: Great Tablet
customer_reviews.text: Got this after owning the Surface RT since it has more features. Will also be able to download movies much easier; size and weight a big plus.
customer_reviews.author: gariam

customer_reviews.title: Optimum performance, but very heavy and hot!
customer_reviews.text: The product works perfect. It is very powerful, the screen is excellent. But definitely not a tablet. It is very heavy to read ebooks, and becomes very hot to hold in your hands.
customer_reviews.author: Milton Cor

customer_reviews.title: Well designed....
customer_reviews.text: ...but a ton to get used to for one familiar with traditional Windows. I still can't URL's in email to launch, but must be an option. Again, VERY frustrating but after a few more weeks it should be OK.
customer_reviews.author: Biggles

customer_reviews.title: First version
customer_reviews.text: Too many mechanical issues, software glitches. Falling apart in power connector. Lamp there no longer works. Keyboard sometimes does not attach. Performance is pretty good though.
customer_reviews.author: iharogre

customer_reviews.title: This arrived well before the estimated arrival dates!
customer_reviews.text: This is in great condition and I really like this tablet. It will be good for college classes and just about anything I need to do. You can't beat the portability of this machine!
customer_reviews.author: klweb

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful device for art!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this a few months ago and I'm still using it religiously. Pros: -sleek -fast -touchscreen -optimized for windows 8. -wacom feel digitizer. -sturdy Cons: -supplied stylus is really odd. I purchased the Feel stylus from Wacom. -Rigid kickstand -UEFI bios makes it difficult if you're wanting to dual boot OS. (There are ways around it).
customer_reviews.author: Alex Redmon

customer_reviews.title: The Best
customer_reviews.text: The Surface is great, easy to use. Love it. Quick delivery in my book. Will put my desktop on retirement for a long time. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Jerardo De Leon

customer_reviews.title: Not as described
customer_reviews.text: Awful, got this product first day screen blacked out. Lost me $800 dollars was suppose to be used at an event
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: but awesome tablet. Would highly recommend to anyone
customer_reviews.text: Very thick, but awesome tablet. Would highly recommend to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: MrPuzzlez

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: The charging cable stopped working after 2 months of use.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Williams

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: My grandparents bought this for me for my bday and I love it! Its like a real computer and I like how I can use it as a tablet as well
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a salesperson to use out in the field to do estimating and she loves this computer.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Powers

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works like my Pro 2. Though it's used still in good condition.
customer_reviews.author: MonJ

customer_reviews.title: Cheat. The product is not correct.
customer_reviews.text: Cheat.The product is not correct. Surface Pro into Surface RT
customer_reviews.author: anhpham

customer_reviews.title: Carefull
customer_reviews.text: Be careful with these as they are refurb units from the UK. I am having a dickens of a time getting English(US) language to load.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Currie

customer_reviews.title: England
customer_reviews.text: This surface was configured for British users. I had to get help to change the settings.
customer_reviews.author: ethucon

customer_reviews.title: Nicest Windows Tablet
customer_reviews.text: I have owned 2 other tablets before this one that were slow and sort of clunky feeling. The Surface feels solid and reliable but the best part is the processor. Microsoft uses the Intel Core i5 in the Surface Pro and it responds so much faster that it almost makes it seem like an Ipad with a really bad operating system. What can I say, Microsoft will never be Apple? But the old saying is true: You get what you pay for. Skip Samsung, Dell, IBM and all the others and just get a Surface if you need a Windows tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Vocal Music Fan

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: A bit bummed it doesn't support POP email...would have upgraded if known.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Grove

customer_reviews.title: Finest and best product!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely finest and most beautiful tablet-laptop concept. It is just thicker I expected. I am waiting bigger screen and thinner surface pro for future.
customer_reviews.author: burak

customer_reviews.title: It works pretty well. I don't find myself using it as ...
customer_reviews.text: It works pretty well. I don't find myself using it as much as I'd thought. I think its actually because the touchpad on the covers suck.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Get it!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Affordable, fast. Its like a computer the size of a book! One of my better purchases. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Jennelle

customer_reviews.title: Surface tablet could use some better user manual writers
customer_reviews.text: detachable keyboard does not work as well as I hoped. Many inconsistencies in user manual. Battery does not last as long as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Flash

customer_reviews.title: Great as computer and tablet
customer_reviews.text: The Surface has met all of my needs for a computer as well as a tablet. With the keyboard and the ability to use a mouse, it functions as a computer, but when needed you can detach the keyboard and simply use it as a tablet. The stylus is a great addition.
customer_reviews.author: Keeping it Real

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift for my nephew who says it runs hot when downloading other than that he has had no problems.Thinking that he may need more storage space.
customer_reviews.author: Valasteen Hooper-Jones

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, bad battery life and multiple problems with seller
customer_reviews.text: Arrived missing the stylus and with a bent cord that was positional. Also arrived with an invalid microsoft serial number. After spending hours not he phone with microsoft to get it right I found that the battery only lasted about an hour of normal use. I ended up returning and getting a surface pro 2 that was much more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: NHMedic431

customer_reviews.title: Item came with no warranty, literature, sale items/codes, contact info, etc. It came with nothing.
customer_reviews.text: I feel a bit cheated. The Surface Pro2 came stripped of the warranty, serial number info, literature, sale items/codes, contact info, etc. It came with nothing; not one sheet of paper. There are several deals, that were advertised with the purchase of the Surface Pro 2. Without the codes and information, I have nothing. I don't even have information on using the device.
customer_reviews.author: Sherrie L. McCracken

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Product was broke. Thank God it was still under warranty with Microsoft.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Higginbotham

customer_reviews.title: Did not meet expectations
customer_reviews.text: Had to return it due to not being acceptable for my office. It does not support Active X which is required by my IT department.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Malecki

customer_reviews.title: Not complete!
customer_reviews.text: This tablet did not come with office or a stylus. By the time I buy both, it will be more than what Best buy charges.
customer_reviews.author: Chainsaw

customer_reviews.title: Nothing Good
customer_reviews.text: I spent a lot of extra money to get a powerful machine. Screens would not reduce or enlarge. Touch was very bad, you had to hit the same place 3 or 4 times to get any action. Stylus was no better, screen simply did not respond. Ran hotter than my pre-1970 dorm hot plate (and used as much energy) Battery life was, therefore, terrible,
customer_reviews.author: DickC

customer_reviews.title: OS failure while under warranty, unable to get replacement
customer_reviews.text: My device had a OS failure early on which the Mircosoft store tested and confirmed it was part of that small percentage that is a dud. Now I'm having issues getting a replacement (still under warranty) from Microsoft because they believe this is an enterprise device that can't be registered to individual account. I'm not able to take advantage of the warranty that was promised and believe this Amazon retailer is selling less than full quality MS products.
customer_reviews.author: El Hussy

customer_reviews.title: Why This Surface Is A Surface To Keep
customer_reviews.text: This device has a wide range of expandibility, and is comparible to its heir-type devices (Surface 2, 3, and 4) in many of it's features. While later models are quite more powerful, have better infrastructure, and even more effecient touch-screen hardware and software (Surface Pen) this type of Surface Pro is still a very decent deal to settle with. I recommend this device for professionals and college students.
customer_reviews.author: Devin

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tablet for the price...
customer_reviews.text: It's AMAZING THIS TABLET. Super fast, clean and looks like new.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: There was a problem with the keyboard on this product. Two of the keys (totally unrelated and in different parts of the keyboard) were alternated with each other, so if I tried to type an @, I would get a semicolon and vice versa. Very strange. Nobody at Microsoft had any idea. Additionally, it is pretty heavy for a product its size and the battery life is not nearly as long as advertised. I returned this and purchased a touchscreen laptop for roughly the same price that works much better and has better battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Medcait

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: like it but did not like the plug that came with it
customer_reviews.author: Milly

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very convenient. High performance (for example, with Google Chrome with over 30 open tabs).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: PURE GENIUS!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: GREAT PC/TABLET I AM SO IMPRESSED WITH WHAT MICROSOFT HAS DONE! GREAT JOB MICROSOFT NOW IF ONLY THEY CAN FIGURE OUT HOW TO CREATE A PORTABLE BATTERY CHARGER FOR THE SURFACE THEN IT WILL BE A MASTER PIECE!
customer_reviews.author: Shannabeess

customer_reviews.title: The surface itself works pretty well, but the charger broke within a year ...
customer_reviews.text: The surface itself works pretty well, but the charger broke within a year for no reason. It slowly became unable to keep a connection with my computer. Now when I attach the charger to my surface it initially signifies it is charging by the light, but then three seconds later it will stop charging (without me touching it or moving it in any way). Microsoft's new supposedly innovative charger connection does not seem to be very durable.
customer_reviews.author: K275

customer_reviews.title: On the go device
customer_reviews.text: It's good for people who want to work on something on the go. Good for students
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: It's a good product, but it seems to be slower than ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a good product, but it seems to be slower than advertised. I understand it's an older gen, but still, it should be able to handle two processes at once.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great tab if you know what to expect.
customer_reviews.text: It is by no means a replacement for your ipad, or android tablet. Its a replacement for your laptop, or desktop(did someone say full, and legacy Windows apps?) My biggest complaint would have to be the speakers. I dont know what they were thinking when they made a $1000 device, and put 50 cents worth of speakers in it. I was skeptical of Windows 8, but its right at home on a tablet. The desktop feels like an ad on though. Overall its a great experience. I'm glad I purchased one. I might even be in the market for an RT soon!
customer_reviews.author: B. Yearwood

customer_reviews.title: Lovin the Tablet!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love the product. I am excited about it. I haven't had any problems so far. I got this and put my android tablet down!! Now all i need is a keyboard and a stylus and I'm all set.
customer_reviews.author: Milton C.

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: I had to take this into the Windows store because I wasn't getting any updates because the time zone I was in was not correct. Now that I've got that fixed, it works great. Most of that is my lack of knowledge in the area but it might be helpful to include that bit of info with the device. The device itself was clean and brand new in appearance. Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Hoover

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from my Surface RT and am glad. One unresolved issue: it will not recognize the Apple SuperDrive despite hours on the phone with Microsoft support. HOWEVER i also own a soft a LITEON drive which works just fine. Seemingly, the 64GB memory seems adequate for my use.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Shaw

customer_reviews.title: System Performance Very Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Battery kept overheating. I returned it to the seller. Very disappointed by the system's performance.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Fairly good
customer_reviews.text: Work well. A only weak point is the size of SSD. It has 64GB but only 25GB is available because of recovery partition.
customer_reviews.author: HONGSUK KANG

customer_reviews.title: much more than a tablet. Love it
customer_reviews.text: basically, it is much more than a tablet, it runs very fast, and the exterior is elegant. besides, i can upgrade the OS to the newest windows 8.1
customer_reviews.author: PM

customer_reviews.title: The Surface from Microsoft
customer_reviews.text: I gave up my Ipad as it just didn't do everything I needed it to. And bought the surface instead. My only complaint is that 10 inches is still a little small. But it does do everything I needed it to!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Eidler

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: I recently opened my own company to offer IT consulting services; with the number of clients, several projects, and meetings at different locations with different teams, the Surface Pro was a GREAT replacement for my laptop, it does have all the power that I need to perform my offsite activities while being lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Jose O Moreno

customer_reviews.title: speed!
customer_reviews.text: Yes, I like, delivery fast, good thing. Most important, cheap ah... Ha ha ha The machine is also very good, the performance of the machine is very high, very practical
customer_reviews.author: tang

customer_reviews.title: Really cool
customer_reviews.text: Great packing, great machine. Light and easy. Has two packs of screen protectors~ and a bag for protection. Really thoughtful
customer_reviews.author: Tan Lixi

customer_reviews.title: Great Tablet!
customer_reviews.text: Best tablet I have owned. Coming from Apple and Android based tablets, the Surface offers everything I need in one device.
customer_reviews.author: rlort01

product_meta.title: Microsoft Surface Pro Tablet Black - 64GB, 10.6"
product_meta.description: The Microsoft Surface Pro fits a full ultrabook experience in a compact 10 inch tablet. Thanks to the ingenious Type and Touch covers (sold separately), it offers a comfortable interface and typing experience that is as comfortable and often times as powerful as a laptop. The clean design and sharp 1080p HD screen rise make it a force to be reckoned with.
feature_bullets: Intel Core i5 (3rd Gen) 3317U / 1.7 GHz Max Turbo Speed: 2.6 GHz (Dual-Core)
16:9 Widescreen with 10-Point multi-touch touchscreen and Intel HD Graphics 4000
Stylus Included - USB 3.0, Mini DisplaPort, Headphone output, MicroSDXC reader

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars134 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
